name: How to use the sandbox - Adding and removing nodes
description: This tutorial will show how to add and remove nodes using the drag+drop and add-on-click features on both desktop and mobile versions.

pages.textBefore: To add nodes to the sandbox, first find the drawer on the left of the screen (or bottom if on mobile). If the drawer is hidden, press the open arrows button.
pages.textAfter: The circled button opens the drawer. On mobile there is a similar button near the bottom-right edge of the screen.

pages.textBefore: Inside the drawer, there is a list of nodes. To add one to the sandbox, drag a node from the list into the viewport area. On mobile, press and wait until the node becomes highlighted (around a third of a second) and then drag it into the viewport.
pages.textAfter: This image shows a highlighted node after being held down. To add the node, drag it into the viewport area (shown by the arrow).

pages.textBefore: To add multiple instances of the same node quickly, enable add-on-click mode by clicking the '+' button next to the node. When add-on-click is enabled, clicking on the viewport area will create a node at that position unless there is already a node there. To switch to a different node, click the '+' button on a different node or click it again to disable add-on-click.
pages.textAfter: The arrow points to the add-on-click button in its enabled state. The circled node is the cursor that shows where the node will be placed.

pages.textBefore: To remove a node, select it in the viewport area and click the delete button in the top right corner. Optionally, it is possible to press the Delete key to remove the selected node.
pages.textAfter: In the image, the translating node is selected and the arrow points to the delete button.

pages.textBefore: For nodes that contain editable points (e.g. the polygonal translating node), there is a separate button that toggles the point delete mode. When the point delete mode is enabled, clicking on the points within a node removes them. This mode persists across different nodes so don't forget to disable it.
pages.textAfter: In the image, the arrow shows the toggle point delete mode button. A solid red means that the point delete mode is enabled. When the mode is enabled, clicking on a point (one is circled in the image) will remove it.
